required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Local Metabolomic Alterations in Blood and Muscle Tissue in Intermittent Claudication
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Local Metabolomic Alterations in Blood and Muscle Tissue in Intermittent Claudication

brief_summary.textblock:
The most common clinical presentation of lower extremity arterial disease is intermittent claudication. Current understanding of the pathophysiology of intermittent claudication, as well as its treatment options are limited. The progression of the disease may lead to lower limb amputation, which is devastating for patients' quality of life and is a huge socio-economic burden to society.
Current study allows to determine the acute local metabolomic alterations in the ischaemic limb of the patient with intermittent claudication, and investigate the associations between the metabolomic alterations and the patient's maximal walking distance. This provides potentially valuable insight into the pathophysiology of this disease, and helps lay the groundwork for identifying potential novel targets for instituting more effective therapies for this high-risk population.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in local metabolomic profile after treadmill exercise as reflected by arteriovenous gradients of low-molecular metabolites.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood sampling at two points in time: Baseline (Day 1) & 10-15 minutes after treadmill test (Day 2).
primary_outcome.description: Measured using liquid chromatography combined with mass spectrometry (AbsoluteIDQ MxP Quant 500 Kit, BIOCRATES Life Sciences AG, Austria).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in local inflammatory profile after treadmill exercise as reflected by arteriovenous gradients of inflammatory mediators (IL-6, MPO, SOD, NOX isoform 1, NOX isoform 2, NOX isoform 5, nitrotyrosine, 8-iso-PGF2α).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood sampling at two points in time: Baseline (Day 1) & 10-15 minutes after treadmill test (Day 2).
primary_outcome.description: Measured using enzyme linked immunosorbent assay. Measurement unit: ng/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in local metabolomic profile after treadmill exercise as reflected by absolute concentrations of low-molecular metabolites in muscle biopsy.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Biopsy at two points in time: Baseline (Day 1) & 15-20 minutes after treadmill test (Day 2).
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using liquid chromatography combined with mass spectrometry (AbsoluteIDQ MxP Quant 500 Kit, BIOCRATES Life Sciences AG, Austria).

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlations between maximal walking distance and exercise-induced changes in local metabolomic and inflammatory profiles.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Data analysis after the enrollment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlations between baseline arterial functionality/hemodynamic parameters and exercise-induced changes in local metabolomic and inflammatory profiles.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Data analysis after the enrollment period.

other_outcome.measure: Maximal walking distance on a treadmill (m).
Peripheral blood pressure, central blood pressure (mmHg).
Identification of systemic metabolomic profile as reflected by absolute concentrations of low-molecular metabolites in peripheral blood sample.
other_outcome.time_frame: Blood sampling at one point in time: Baseline (Day 1)
other_outcome.description: Measured using liquid chromatography combined with mass spectrometry (AbsoluteIDQ MxP Quant 500 Kit, BIOCRATES Life Sciences AG, Austria).

other_outcome.measure: Identification of systemic inflammatory profile as reflected by absolute concentrations of inflammatory mediators (IL-6, MPO, SOD, NOX isoform 1, NOX isoform 2, NOX isoform 5, nitrotyrosine, 8-iso-PGF2α) in peripheral blood sample.
other_outcome.time_frame: Blood sampling at one point in time: Baseline (Day 1)
other_outcome.description: Measured using enzyme linked immunosorbent assay. Measurement unit: ng/mL.

clinical_study.condition: Peripheral Arterial Occlusive Disease Fontaine Stage IIa

biospec_descr.textblock: Whole blood, serum, plasma, frozen tissue.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with mild intermittent claudication (Fontaine IIa).
